body_html:
@terrylyons your best bet is to run things as close to the Jenkins CI builds as you possibly can. That means running

./.jenkins/pytorch/win-build.sh

An example of this passing (with logs) is https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-win-ws2016-cuda9-cudnn7-py3-build/22650/console

Maybe check to see what's different between your logs and those above?

Also cc @mingzhe09088 since I thought he might have fixed the / vs \ issue, but not sure.

body:
@terrylyons your best bet is to run things as close to the Jenkins CI builds as you possibly can. That means running 

```
./.jenkins/pytorch/win-build.sh
```
An example of this passing (with logs) is https://ci.pytorch.org/jenkins/job/pytorch-builds/job/pytorch-win-ws2016-cuda9-cudnn7-py3-build/22650/console

Maybe check to see what's different between your logs and those above?

Also cc @mingzhe09088 since I thought he might have fixed the `/` vs `\` issue, but not sure.
